page.title: 11RELIGION.
page.content: This is still an important aspect of village life, but the newcomers to the village are less involved and as their numbers grow there are fewer villages to maintain religious life. Traditionally the villages were divided into two main groups, Anglicans and Methodists. Today there are three groups; Anglicans, Methodists and the non_religious. Of a population of about 300 about thirty worship each week in the Parish Church,twelve at the Methodist chapel. There are two or Three families which are Catholic. Church members are optimistic and have this year reroofed the 13th century church at a cost of Â£18,000. The methodists are also planning to refloor their chapel.
